long_desc.thetext:
Install python-tidy, which pulls in libtidy. Try to import tidy from a python program and get:
>>> import tidy Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tidy/__init__.py", line 43, in <module> from tidy.lib import parse, parseString File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tidy/lib.py", line 33, in <module> raise OSError("Couldn't find libtidy, please make sure it is installed.") OSError: Couldn't find libtidy, please make sure it is installed.
This is because it searches for the tidy library using a number of different names, none of which are installed.
Install libtidy-devel, which provides libtidy.so, and now it works.
Thanks for report, dep on -devel package seems wrong too, will have a look.
